metadata.Title: CVE-2021-40797 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in the routes middleware in OpenStack Neutron before 16.4.1, 17.x before 17.2.1, and 18.x before 18.1.1. By making API requests involving nonexistent controllers, an authenticated user may cause the API worker to consume increasing amounts of memory, resulting in API performance degradation or denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2021-40797` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

neutron-common - 2:18.1.1+git2021091315.0fa97ecceb-0ubuntu1
neutron-dhcp-agent - 2:18.1.1+git2021091315.0fa97ecceb-0ubuntu1
neutron-l3-agent - 2:18.1.1+git2021091315.0fa97ecceb-0ubuntu1
neutron-linuxbridge-agent - 2:18.1.1+git2021091315.0fa97ecceb-0ubuntu1
neutron-macvtap-agent - 2:18.1.1+git2021091315.0fa97ecceb-0ubuntu1
neutron-metadata-agent - 2:18.1.1+git2021091315.0fa97ecceb-0ubuntu1
neutron-metering-agent - 2:18.1.1+git2021091315.0fa97ecceb-0ubuntu1
neutron-openvswitch-agent - 2:18.1.1+git2021091315.0fa97ecceb-0ubuntu1
neutron-ovn-metadata-agent - 2:18.1.1+git2021091315.0fa97ecceb-0ubuntu1
neutron-plugin-ml2 - 2:18.1.1+git2021091315.0fa97ecceb-0ubuntu1
neutron-server - 2:18.1.1+git2021091315.0fa97ecceb-0ubuntu1
neutron-sriov-agent - 2:18.1.1+git2021091315.0fa97ecceb-0ubuntu1
python3-neutron - 2:18.1.1+git2021091315.0fa97ecceb-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> This issue is fixed in (2:16.4.1-0ubuntu2) in focal-updates and (2:18.1.1-0ubuntu2) in hirsute-updates, but they have not yet been released to -security.

criterions.comment: neutron package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2:18.1.1+git2021091315.0fa97ecceb-0ubuntu1').
